title: Global growth is set to slow — but there are 'pockets of resilience,' Moody's says
description: A global slowdown in growth and stickier inflation risks persist, but some pockets of resilience remain, said Moody's Investors Service.

title: Taylor Swift, Beyoncé and 'Barbenheimer' are lifting consumer spending this quarter. But Morgan Stanley says it may not last
description: Morgan Stanley sees a potential unwinding from these events, as well as the resumption of student loan payments, in the fourth quarter.

title: Lululemon sees sales and profit jump 18%, boosts full-year guidance
description: Lululemon saw its sales and profit rise 18% during its most recent quarter and raised its full-year guidance.

title: U.S. health officials want to loosen marijuana restrictions. Here's what it means
description: If marijuana is downgraded to a Schedule III drug, it could be a huge boost to a struggling industry.

title: Biden says he's 'forever grateful' to forces in Afghanistan on two-year anniversary of exit
description: Biden ordered the full withdrawal of approximately 3,000 U.S. troops from Afghanistan by Aug. 31 2021.

title: Sixth Street — which manages more than $70 billion — is betting big on sports teams and live events
description: Alan Waxman, the CEO and co-founder of Sixth Street, talked about his vision in the increasingly crowded sports industry.

title: Fintech giant Wise allowed Russia sanctions target to withdraw money, UK government says
description: An individual on the U.K.'s Russia sanctions list was allowed to make a withdrawal of £250 ($316.63) from a business account on Wise, a government body said.

title: Tesla reportedly facing DOJ, SEC probes over plans to build Elon Musk a large glass house
description: Tesla is reportedly facing two new federal probes over possible misuse of company resources by or for the personal benefit of CEO Elon Musk.

title: Shopify stock pops after company strikes 'Buy with Prime' deal with Amazon
description: The agreement serves as a detente between the two companies after Shopify initially urged merchants not to use Buy with Prime, citing security risks.

title: Trump pleads not guilty to election charges in Georgia, waives arraignment
Adani shares slide after report alleges 'opaque' offshore investment funds
description: Shares of Adani Enterprises, as well as its subsidiaries fell Thursday following new allegations of stock manipulation published by OCCRP.

title: A 'historic' result but still a 'construction site': Analysts react to blowout UBS earnings
description: UBS shares rallied to 15-year highs on the back of what analysts branded a "historic" earnings report, though Deutsche Bank said the lender may remain a "construction site" for some time.

title: Why airlines aren't boarding planes the most efficient way
description: Have you ever noticed how inefficient the airplane boarding process is? CNBC checked out Southwest Airlines' study in Atlanta to speed up the process.

title: Euro zone price rises steady for August but core inflation declines further
description: Inflation in the euro zone came in higher than analysts had expected for the month of August, although coming in unchanged from the previous month and complicating the role of the region's central bank.

title: Microsoft to unbundle Teams software in Europe in bid to abate EU antitrust concerns
description: European Union regulators had in July opened an antitrust investigation into Microsoft's bundling of Teams with other Office products, citing anti-competitive concerns.

title: China says drop in trade with the U.S. is 'a direct consequence of U.S. moves'
description: China's ambassador to the U.S., Xie Feng, has blamed U.S. tariffs and export controls for a drop in trade between the two countries.

title: Buy now, pay later firm Klarna cuts losses in first half but falls short of profit
description: Swedish buy now, pay later firm Klarna reduced losses by roughly 67% in the first half of 2023, as it cut costs dramatically in a bid for profitability.

title: Disgruntled Europeans hit out at banks for not passing on higher rates on savings
description: European savers complain lenders are quick to raise mortgage costs, but very slow at increasing returns on deposits.

title: UBS posts $29 billion second-quarter profit in first results since Credit Suisse takeover
description: UBS on Thursday posted a second-quarter profit of $28.9 billion in its first quarterly earnings since Switzerland's largest bank completed its takeover of stricken rival Credit Suisse.

title: Baidu gets China's green light to release its ChatGPT-like Ernie bot to the public
description: Chinese tech giant Baidu announced Thursday its ChatGPT-like Ernie bot was now open to the public at large.

title: China's factory activity shrinks for a fifth straight month in August
description: China's factory activity in August shrank for a fifth straight month, while non-manufacturing activity hit another low for the year.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Fewer jobs, higher stocks
description: Bad news is good news again for markets. Downwardly revised economic growth and lower-than-expected job creation boosted markets.

title: Southeast Asia's first high-speed train – a boon or bust for Indonesia's economy?
description: The project is funded by PT KCIC and was expected to be completed by 2019 but has since been held back by operational delays and a $1.2 billion budget overrun.

title: Op-ed: Why the world needs more oil, not less
description: If oil vanished today, these and many other vital products and services that use oil or its derivatives would vanish too.

title: Consumer spending in China bounced back in August, survey finds
description: Consumer spending bounced back in August after a tepid July, according to the China Beige Book's survey of Chinese businesses released Thursday.
